articles.author: Daniella Diaz, Jennifer Hansler, Nicky Robertson and Sonnet Swire, CNN
articles.title: Rep. McCaul claims Taliban not allowing US citizens to depart Mazar-i-Sharif airport - CNN
articles.description: Rep. Michael McCaul, the top Republican on the House Foreign Affairs Committee, said he has received classified briefings that American citizens and Afghan allies are stuck at the Mazar-i-Sharif airport in Afghanistan.

articles.title: Planes stranded at Mazar-i-Sharif airport waiting to leave - BBC News

articles.content:

articles.title: GOP Lawmaker Claims Taliban Currently Holding Americans 'Hostage for Demands' - The Daily Beast
articles.description: Rep. McCaul alleged that the Taliban is preventing six airplanes full of Americans and Afghan allies in northern Afghanistan from departing despite clearance from the State Dept.
articles.content: At least four chartered planes with several hundred intended passengers have been unable to leave the country for days, the Associated Press reported on Sunday. An Afghan official told the news wire … [+1131 chars]

articles.title: A growing number of companies, from American Airlines to Match and Uber, have spoken out against Texas' restrictive new abortion law - Yahoo! Voices
articles.description: Big players in the business world are calling out Texas' "regressive" new law, including Lyft, which called it "an attack on women's right to choose."
articles.content:
Companies are speaking out against Texas' harsh new anti-abortion law.
